name: blah
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not very good, special, or interesting: It's a stylish restaurant but the food is kind of blah. Synonym
meh
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
not interesting or excitingboringThat was such a boring film I nearly fell asleep during it.excruciatingShe went over the plot of the book in excruciating detail.deadlyHis latest film was just deadly. I left after the first hour!mind-numbingThe incident was described in a mind-numbing, 400-page report so dense that no one read it.
See more results »
not feeling much interest, energy, or excitement: I was feeling a bit blah and I left early.
More examplesFewer examplesI thought Joan was a fantastic character whereas Ann was just blah.In the winter we often feel more blah than beautiful.If you are feeling blah about things, trying changing your routine.

[ U ] disapproving a lot of speech or writing that has very little meaning: Don't invent a lot of blah about fate and destiny. The speech contained no actual policy proposals, just blah. Synonym
blather
[ U ] a word, phrase, amount, etc. when you do not say or know exactly which, sometimes used when you are giving an example: You might read in a magazine that so-and-so says blah about so-and-so. Blah squared is blah multiplied by blah. Synonym
x the blahs US
a feeling of having very little interest, energy, or excitement: Stay physically active to stop the winter blahs getting to you. The thought of making dinner every night leaves me with the blahs.
More examplesFewer examplesThere followed more blah about music than I have ever heard in my life.

See also
blah, blah, blah
to talk a lot in a way that has very little meaning: I wish they'd all stop blahing about politics. The media has been blahing on about this for months. Synonym
blather
More examplesFewer examplesI'm blahing now—I've lost my thread.They can blah on as much as they like—nobody's listening.
